newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Dutch shares end lower, recent bliss ending.
newsitem.headline: Dutch shares end lower, recent bliss ending.

text.p: Dutch shares ended lower, after a dipping Wall Street opening and falling U.S. jobless claims added to already weaker sentiment.
Dealers said they expected a sideways pattern in the near-term since recent euphoria was fading.
The AEX share index slipped 3.47 points to 584.37. "The index is likely to linger between 580-590 points," said one dealer, adding new highs were not expected in the near term.
KLM closed at a year-low at 41.60 guilders, off 1.40.
Industrial holding firm Atag and retail chain KBB nosedived on unfavourable profit forecasts.
